heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.2°C) and outside temperature (down 4.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 51.6°C), dew point temperature (up 48.0°C), outside temperature (up 51.5°C), and cloud levels (up 276 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 452.8m lower than yesterday, 275.7m lower than the past week, 152.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1094m to a maximum of 3930m, averaging 1567.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1842.7m and 1719.6m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, occasional overcast conditions, and the light is absent. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (4.0°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
